DOC.HEAD: Nuclear Plant Unaffected By Quakes in Yugoslavia
DOC.TEXT: Three mild earthquakes occurred near Yugoslavia's only nuclear power plant Saturday, but no damage was reported. The facility had just reopened after being closed by earlier quakes. No injuries or other damage were reported from Saturday's tremors, which shook the Krsko area in northwest Yugoslavia, the Tanjug news agency said. The official report said the first tremor measured four on the 12-point Mercalli scale and that the others were weaker. A police source in Slovenia, where Krsko is located, said in a telephone interview that the plant remained running during and after the tremors. The plant had just reopened Friday after being closed following four quakes on Thursday that measured up to 3.4 on the Mercalli scale. The Mercalli scale runs from 1 to 12.
